alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:09PM EST until February 05 at 10:25PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash River. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. This ice jam threat should come to an end over the weekend, but minor river flooding along the Wabash is expected to continue well into next week, aided by additional rainfall expected during the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, FEBRUARY 05... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Monday, February 05. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, High water surrounds elevated river cabins. County roads to these cabins are impassable. Agricultural flooding is in progress. Seep water develops behind levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Friday /8:00 PM CST Friday/ the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Friday /8:00 PM CST Friday/ was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.8 feet Friday, February 02. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, February 05. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around noon EST /1100 AM CST/.
